wikipedia_page.main: Valerie Lane-Fox Pitt-Rivers  (born 1939) served as Lord Lieutenant of Dorset from 2006 until 2014. Upon her appointment as Lord Lieutenant in 2006, Pitt-Rivers became the first female Lord Lieutenant of Dorset and served as the representative of Queen Elizabeth II in the County of Dorset until her compulsory retirement at the age of 75 in 2014.

response: In the 2013 New Year Honours list she was awarded the British Empire Medal for services to museums. This was presented to her in May 2013 by Valerie Pitt-Rivers, the Lord Lieutenant of Dorset.
